text: Canton of Marseille-Montolivet is a former canton located within the commune of Marseille in the Bouches-du-Rhône department of France. It was created 27 February 2003 by the decree 2003-156 of that date. It was disbanded following the French canton reorganisation which came into effect in March 2015. Its population was 34,274 in 2012.Populations légales 2012: Téléchargement du fichier d'ensemble, INSEE Elected to represent the canton in the General Council of Bouches-du-Rhône : * Maurice Rey (UMP, 2001-2008) ==Area== It is composed of the part of the 12th municipal arrondissement of Marseille not included in the Canton of Marseille-La Blancarde and situated west of an imaginary line along chemin de la Parette and the walking path that extend from it (traverse Gaston-de-Flotte) from the border with the 11th municipal arrondissement until avenue Van-Gogh. It then continues along avenue de la Fourragère, avenue des Caillols, avenue de la Figonne, traverse de Courtrai, traverse du Fort-Fouque, avenue du 24-avril-1915, rue Pierre-Béranger, traverse des Massaliottes, chemin des Sables, rue de Charleroi, boulevard des Fauvettes, boulevard Pinatel, chemin des Amaryllis and finally rue Charles- Kaddouz until it meets the 13th municipal arrondissement. == See also == * Arrondissement of Marseille * Cantons of the Bouches-du-Rhône department * Communes of the Bouches-du-Rhône department ==References== Category:Former cantons of Marseille Marseille-Montolivet Category:2015 disestablishments in France Category:States and territories disestablished in 2015 Category:2003 establishments in France
title: Canton of Marseille-Montolivet
